“Why don’t you work?” the innkeeper asked.

“Why am I not at my duty?” Marmeladov replied, eyes downcast. 

“My heart aches. I’m a useless worm.”

He paused, searching Raskolnikov’s face. 

“Have you ever petitioned hopelessly for a loan?”

“Yes, I have. But what do you mean?”

“Hopelessly. You know you’ll get nothing. 

This reputable citizen won’t help. Why should he? 

I can’t pay it back. Compassion is forbidden now, you see.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Marmeladov reflects on the despair of beggary and the hopelessness of seeking help from others while grappling with his own failures and the consequences of his alcoholism.
